meanings.definition: To do beforehand or in advance.
meanings.sent1: She always likes foredoing her homework to have more free time later.
meanings.sent2: He will foredo the preparations for the party to ensure everything goes smoothly.
meanings.sent3: Foredoing the laundry before it piles up makes her feel like a superhero.
meanings.sent4: Foredoing his work assignments gives him a sense of control over his schedule.
meanings.sent5: Foredoing tasks helps in avoiding last-minute stress and panic.

meanings.definition: The act of doing something before it is necessary or expected.
meanings.sent1: His foredoing of the project impressed the team with his proactive approach.
meanings.sent2: The foredoing of the chores made the weekend more relaxing for everyone.
meanings.sent3: Her foredoing of packing for the trip made her friends tease her for being overly prepared.
meanings.sent4: The foredoing of saving money early on proved to be beneficial during unexpected expenses.
meanings.sent5: The foredoing of studying ahead helped him excel in the exam.
